definition: passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: This sad love story has passed from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 这个悲楚动人的故事一代代相传。

sentences.english: However, early music was not handed down from generation to generation or recorded.
sentences.chinese: 然而，早期音乐却未能代代相传或记录下来。

sentences.english: County, Rong Guan camp hydrangea dragon is the way down from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 清苑县戎官营的绣球龙灯，就是这样代代相传下来。

sentences.english: You must build a memorial that will last through the generations.
sentences.chinese: 你们要建造的必须是能够代代相传的纪念馆。

sentences.english: Proverb such as "Where there is a will, there is a way" will certainly be spread generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 像“有只者事竟成”这样的谚语一定会代代相传。

sentences.english: But we just feel a real responsibility to preserve this for future generations.
sentences.chinese: 但我们却感到了要把这段历史代代相传的责任。

sentences.english: This custom is transmitted from generation to generation.
They desire to create heirlooms through the photographs for generations of storytelling.
sentences.chinese: 他们渴望通过照片创造可以代代相传的传家之宝。

sentences.english: The title  descends through eldest sons.
How poverty passes from generation to generation is now becoming clearer.
sentences.chinese: 贫困是怎样代代相传的问题现在已经越来越清楚了。

sentences.english: So why do we pass this and other superstitions down from generation to generation?
sentences.chinese: 那么，为何人们会将这种迷信以及其它迷信代代相传？

sentences.english: The Yami language transmits this rich culinary and cultural knowledge of fish.
sentences.chinese: 雅美语将这种丰富的烹饪与鱼类文化知识代代相传。

definition: passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
from generation to generation/generation after generation
to develop and promote/to carry forward/to bring to great height of development
lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another
